show_title: Gm Farcaster Ep137 Friday  August 2  2024 With A Base Camp Recap
text:
Morning is over here in the 808 state, and after watching all of the /basecamp vids, casts, and announcements; all of the @moxie.eth adoption and auctions; the /wufs vibechecks, the /gmfarcaster updates; taken together with last night's /latenightcrew hilarious conclusion, you can see clearly what the answer is to why people are going to come to Farcaster.  

It's the collective basket, the cultural movement of services, features, stories, and relationships that are going to draw them away from the closed networks of trad social. The benefits of FC/WC become clearer through the range of "oh, you can do this" and "you can do that" being created each day, leading to the inevitable "maybe I should try it".

As their friends and their friends start to find their way here, the friction reduces until there is no excuse and the world opens to the potential that being part of a decentralized, open source social graph unlocks. Bullish for the future on FC. LFGO. ‚úåÔ∏è üòÅ

show_title: Gm Farcaster Ep137 Friday  August 2  2024 With A Base Camp Recap
text:
sharing the % breakdown of the cost to build on top of Farcaster:

1. fast database (30%)
2. an indexer for hub (20%)
3. AI (15%)
4. recommendations (5%)
5. data inference, API, etc. (~10%)

majority of early cost will be running a performant database ecosystem.

show_title: Gm Farcaster Ep137 Friday  August 2  2024 With A Base Camp Recap
text:
A lot of chatter recently about Farcaster, marketing and expanding beyond crypto

I have yet to see a crisp definition of:

1. What problem does Farcaster solve for people outside of crypto today?

2. What evidence exists that existing  at-scale free social networks and paid creator tools / platforms are insufficient in serving these people?

3. Assuming this population exists, what channel (i.e. tactics) do you market Farcaster to said people?

I'm not asking for free work, fwiw. It's our job to figure to this out (we don't have an answer for this question ourselves). 

But hiring a "marketing team" when you don't have an answer to this question is not going to solve the problem.

Marketing works great when you have a clear value prop and target market and channel.
